instructions: Each question carries 1 mark. There is no negative marking. Choose the best answer.

questions.subject: Contract Law
questions.question: What is the essential element for a valid contract under Section 10?
options: Free consent of parties competent to contract
questions.explanation: Section 10 requires all mentioned elements for a valid contract.

questions.subject: Contract Law
questions.question: Under which section is consideration defined in the Indian Contract Act?
questions.explanation: Section 2(d) defines consideration as something in return for the promise.

questions.subject: Constitutional Law
questions.question: Which Article of the Constitution guarantees Right to Equality?
questions.explanation: Article 14 guarantees equality before law and equal protection of laws.

questions.subject: Constitutional Law
questions.question: The doctrine of Basic Structure was established in which case?
options: Kesavananda Bharati v. State of Kerala
Maneka Gandhi v. Union of India
Minerva Mills v. Union of India
questions.explanation: Kesavananda Bharati case (1973) established the Basic Structure doctrine.

questions.subject: Criminal Law
questions.question: Murder is defined under which section of IPC?
questions.explanation: Section 300 IPC defines murder; Section 302 prescribes punishment.

questions.subject: Criminal Law
questions.question: What is the maximum period for which police can detain a person without producing before Magistrate?
questions.explanation: Section 57 CrPC requires production within 24 hours excluding journey time.

questions.subject: Contract Law
questions.question: Agreement in restraint of trade is:
questions.explanation: Section 27 declares agreements in restraint of trade as void.

questions.subject: Torts
questions.question: The maxim 'Res ipsa loquitur' means:
questions.explanation: Res ipsa loquitur means the thing speaks for itself, used in negligence cases.

questions.subject: Property Law
questions.question: Transfer of Property Act was enacted in:
questions.explanation: The Transfer of Property Act was enacted in 1882.

questions.subject: Property Law
questions.question: Doctrine of lis pendens is contained in which section of TPA?
questions.explanation: Section 52 deals with doctrine of lis pendens (pending litigation).

questions.subject: Family Law
questions.question: Minimum age for marriage of bride under Hindu Marriage Act is:
questions.explanation: Section 5(iii) mandates bride must be 18+ years (recently amended from proposed 21).

questions.subject: Company Law
questions.question: Companies Act 2013 came into force on:
questions.explanation: Companies Act 2013 came into force on 1st April 2014 (notified provisions).

questions.subject: Professional Ethics
questions.question: Advocates Act was enacted in:
questions.explanation: The Advocates Act, 1961 regulates legal profession in India.

questions.subject: CPC
questions.question: Doctrine of res judicata is contained in:
questions.explanation: Section 11 CPC deals with res judicata (matter already adjudicated).

questions.subject: Evidence Act
questions.question: Indian Evidence Act was enacted in:
questions.explanation: The Indian Evidence Act, 1872 governs law of evidence.

questions.subject: Contract Law
questions.question: Quantum meruit means:
questions.explanation: Quantum meruit means 'as much as earned' - claim for work done.

questions.subject: Constitutional Law
questions.question: Fundamental Duties are contained in:
questions.explanation: Part IVA (Article 51A) contains Fundamental Duties, added by 42nd Amendment.

questions.subject: Criminal Law
questions.question: Cognizable offense means:
questions.explanation: Cognizable offense allows police to arrest without warrant.

questions.subject: Torts
questions.question: In which case was absolute liability principle established?
options: M.C. Mehta v. Union of India
questions.explanation: M.C. Mehta case (Oleum gas leak, 1987) established absolute liability in India.

questions.subject: Property Law
questions.question: How many types of mortgages are recognized under TPA?
questions.explanation: Section 58 recognizes six types of mortgages.

questions.subject: Family Law
questions.question: Triple talaq was made void and criminal offense in:
questions.explanation: Muslim Women (Protection of Rights on Marriage) Act, 2019 banned triple talaq.

questions.subject: Company Law
questions.question: Doctrine of ultra vires was established in:
questions.explanation: Ashbury Railway case established doctrine of ultra vires.

questions.subject: Professional Ethics
questions.question: Bar Council of India was established under:
questions.explanation: BCI was established under Advocates Act, 1961.

questions.subject: CPC
questions.question: A suit must be filed where:
options: Defendant resides or cause of action arose
questions.explanation: Section 20 CPC - suit filed where defendant resides or cause of action arose.

questions.subject: Evidence Act
questions.question: Dying declaration is covered under:
questions.explanation: Section 32(1) deals with dying declarations.

questions.subject: Contract Law
questions.question: Agreement without consideration is:
questions.explanation: Section 25 - void but has three exceptions (love and affection, past voluntary service, time-barred debt).

questions.subject: Constitutional Law
questions.question: Right to Constitutional Remedies is under:
questions.explanation: Article 32 provides right to move Supreme Court for enforcement of fundamental rights.

questions.subject: Criminal Law
questions.question: FIR is recorded under which section?
questions.explanation: Section 154 CrPC deals with First Information Report.

questions.subject: Torts
questions.question: Defamation in permanent form is called:
questions.explanation: Libel is defamation in permanent form; slander is transient.

questions.subject: Property Law
questions.question: Sale of immovable property above Rs. 100 must be:
questions.explanation: Section 54 TPA - sale above Rs. 100 must be by registered document.

questions.subject: Family Law
questions.question: Hindu Succession Act was enacted in:
questions.explanation: Hindu Succession Act, 1956 governs intestate succession among Hindus.

questions.subject: Company Law
questions.question: Minimum number of members in private company:
questions.explanation: Private company requires minimum 2 members (OPC is exception with 1).

questions.subject: Professional Ethics
questions.question: Advocate-client privilege is protected under:
questions.explanation: Section 126 Evidence Act protects attorney-client privilege.

questions.subject: CPC
questions.question: Rejection of plaint is governed by:
questions.explanation: Order VII Rule 11 CPC provides grounds for rejection of plaint.

questions.subject: Evidence Act
questions.question: Burden of proof lies on:
questions.explanation: Section 101 - burden of proof on person who asserts, not who denies.

questions.subject: Contract Law
questions.question: Contract by minor is:
options: Valid if ratified on attaining majority
questions.explanation: Contract by minor is void ab initio (Mohori Bibee case).

questions.subject: Constitutional Law
questions.question: Maximum strength of Lok Sabha:
questions.explanation: Article 81 - Lok Sabha can have maximum 552 members (530 states + 20 UTs + 2 Anglo-Indian).

questions.subject: Criminal Law
questions.question: Anticipatory bail is provided under:
questions.explanation: Section 438 CrPC provides for anticipatory bail.

questions.subject: Torts
questions.question: Vicarious liability means:
questions.explanation: Vicarious liability is liability for wrongful acts of another (e.g., master for servant).

questions.subject: Property Law
questions.question: Doctrine of feeding the grant by estoppel is in:
questions.explanation: Section 43 TPA deals with doctrine of feeding the grant by estoppel.

questions.subject: Family Law
questions.question: Restitution of conjugal rights is under:
questions.explanation: Section 9 Hindu Marriage Act deals with restitution of conjugal rights.

questions.subject: Company Law
questions.question: One Person Company was introduced in:
questions.explanation: OPC concept was introduced in Companies Act, 2013.

questions.subject: Professional Ethics
questions.question: CLE stands for:
questions.explanation: CLE means Continuing Legal Education, mandatory for advocates.

questions.subject: CPC
questions.question: Appeal is a:
questions.explanation: Appeal is statutory right, available only where specifically provided by law.

questions.subject: Evidence Act
questions.question: Leading questions are allowed in:
questions.explanation: Section 142 - leading questions allowed in cross-examination.

questions.subject: Contract Law
questions.question: Doctrine of privity of contract means:
options: Only parties to contract can sue
questions.explanation: Only parties to contract can sue or be sued on it; third parties cannot enforce.

questions.subject: Constitutional Law
questions.question: Preamble declares India as:
questions.explanation: Preamble declares India as Sovereign, Socialist, Secular, Democratic Republic.

questions.subject: Criminal Law
questions.question: Test Identification Parade is conducted during:
questions.explanation: TIP is conducted during investigation for witness to identify accused.

questions.subject: Torts
questions.question: Injuria sine damno means:
questions.explanation: Injuria sine damno - legal injury without actual damage is actionable.

questions.subject: Property Law
questions.question: Gift of immovable property must be:
questions.explanation: Section 123 TPA - gift of immovable property must be by registered document.

questions.subject: Labour Law
questions.question: Industrial Disputes Act was enacted in:
questions.explanation: Industrial Disputes Act, 1947 regulates industrial disputes.

questions.subject: Labour Law
questions.question: Retrenchment compensation is:
questions.explanation: Section 25F - retrenchment compensation is 15 days wages per completed year.

questions.subject: Arbitration
questions.question: Arbitration and Conciliation Act was enacted in:
questions.explanation: Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 based on UNCITRAL Model Law.

questions.subject: Arbitration
questions.question: Arbitral award can be set aside under:
questions.explanation: Section 34 provides grounds for setting aside arbitral award.

questions.subject: Contract Law
questions.question: Anticipatory breach means:
questions.explanation: Anticipatory breach is when party repudiates contract before performance is due.

questions.subject: Constitutional Law
questions.question: President's rule is under:
questions.explanation: Article 356 provides for President's rule in states.

questions.subject: Criminal Law
questions.question: Common intention is under:
questions.explanation: Section 34 IPC deals with common intention.

questions.subject: Torts
questions.question: Rylands v. Fletcher rule relates to:
questions.explanation: Rylands v. Fletcher established rule of strict liability for non-natural use of land.

questions.subject: Property Law
questions.question: Usufructuary mortgage is one where:
questions.explanation: In usufructuary mortgage, mortgagee gets possession and receives rents/profits.

questions.subject: Family Law
questions.question: Iddat period after divorce is:
questions.explanation: Iddat period after divorce is generally three menstrual cycles or three lunar months.

questions.subject: Company Law
questions.question: MOA is charter of company, AOA is:
questions.explanation: AOA contains internal regulations/by-laws/constitution of company.

questions.subject: Professional Ethics
questions.question: Advocate cannot appear for both:
questions.explanation: Advocate cannot appear for conflicting interests in same or related matters.

questions.subject: CPC
questions.question: Written statement must be filed within:
questions.explanation: Order VIII Rule 1 - written statement within 30 days, extendable to 90 days max.

questions.subject: Evidence Act
questions.question: Confession to police officer is:
questions.explanation: Section 25 - confession to police officer is inadmissible.

questions.subject: Contract Law
questions.question: Doctrine of frustration is under:
questions.explanation: Section 56 deals with impossibility and frustration of contract.

questions.subject: Constitutional Law
questions.question: Directive Principles are contained in:
questions.explanation: Part IV (Articles 36-51) contains Directive Principles of State Policy.

questions.subject: Criminal Law
questions.question: Plea bargaining is under:
questions.explanation: Chapter XXI-A CrPC (Sections 265A-265L) deals with plea bargaining.

questions.subject: Torts
questions.question: Damnum sine injuria means:
questions.explanation: Damnum sine injuria - actual damage without violation of legal right, not actionable.

questions.subject: Property Law
questions.question: Doctrine of part performance is under:
questions.explanation: Section 53A TPA deals with doctrine of part performance.

questions.subject: Family Law
questions.question: Dower in Muslim law is:
questions.explanation: Dower (mehr) is consideration wife receives from husband for marriage.

questions.subject: Company Law
questions.question: Doctrine of indoor management is also called:
questions.explanation: Doctrine of indoor management is also known as Turquand's rule.

questions.subject: Professional Ethics
questions.question: Advocate must wear:
questions.explanation: BCI prescribes dress code for advocates appearing in court.

questions.subject: CPC
questions.question: Summary suit procedure is under:
questions.explanation: Order XXXVII provides for summary suit procedure for liquidated demands.

questions.subject: Evidence Act
questions.question: Standard of proof in criminal cases is:
questions.explanation: Criminal cases require proof beyond reasonable doubt.

questions.subject: Contract Law
questions.question: Bailment is defined under:
questions.explanation: Section 148 defines bailment as delivery of goods for specific purpose.

questions.subject: Constitutional Law
questions.question: Constitutional amendment requires:
questions.explanation: Article 368 - amendment procedure varies: simple, special, or special + state ratification.

questions.subject: Criminal Law
questions.question: Private defense extends to causing death for:
questions.explanation: Section 100 IPC - private defense extends to death for offenses like rape, acid attack, robbery.

questions.subject: Torts
questions.question: Absolute liability was established in:
questions.explanation: M.C. Mehta case (1987) established absolute liability doctrine.

questions.subject: Property Law
questions.question: Simple mortgage means:
questions.explanation: Simple mortgage involves personal liability without transferring possession.

questions.subject: Family Law
questions.question: Coparcenary under Hindu law means:
questions.explanation: Coparcenary gives birth right in ancestral property; daughters now equal coparceners.

questions.subject: Company Law
questions.question: CSR provision applies to companies with networth:
questions.explanation: Section 135 - CSR applies to companies with networth Rs. 500 crore+ or turnover Rs. 1000 crore+ or profit Rs. 5 crore+.

questions.subject: Professional Ethics
questions.question: Advocate can refuse brief when:
questions.explanation: Advocate can refuse brief when there's conflict of interest or insufficient remuneration.

questions.subject: CPC
questions.question: Inherent powers of court are under:
questions.explanation: Section 151 CPC provides inherent powers to courts for ends of justice.

questions.subject: Evidence Act
questions.question: Judicial notice means:
options: Facts court takes as proved without evidence
questions.explanation: Section 56-57 - judicial notice means facts court accepts without proof.

questions.subject: Labour Law
questions.question: Factories Act was enacted in:
questions.explanation: Factories Act, 1948 regulates working conditions in factories.

questions.subject: Labour Law
questions.question: Trade Unions Act was enacted in:
questions.explanation: Trade Unions Act, 1926 provides for registration of trade unions.

questions.subject: Arbitration
questions.question: Kompetenz-kompetenz means:
options: Tribunal can rule on own jurisdiction
questions.explanation: Section 16 - kompetenz-kompetenz means tribunal can decide its own jurisdiction.

questions.subject: Arbitration
questions.question: Time limit for filing application to set aside award is:
questions.explanation: Section 34(3) - 3 months from award date, extendable by 30 days.

questions.subject: Contract Law
questions.question: Wagering agreement is:
questions.explanation: Section 30 declares wagering agreements as void.

questions.subject: Constitutional Law
questions.question: Money Bill can be introduced only in:
questions.explanation: Article 110 - Money Bill can be introduced only in Lok Sabha.

questions.subject: Criminal Law
questions.question: Juvenile Justice Act defines child as person below:
questions.explanation: JJ Act, 2015 defines child as person below 18 years.

questions.subject: Torts
questions.question: Nuisance is interference with:
questions.explanation: Nuisance is unlawful interference with use or enjoyment of land.

questions.subject: Property Law
questions.question: Lease for more than one year must be:
questions.explanation: Section 107 TPA - lease for more than one year must be registered.

questions.subject: Family Law
questions.question: Maintenance under Section 125 CrPC can be claimed by:
questions.explanation: Section 125 CrPC - wife, children, and parents unable to maintain themselves can claim.

questions.subject: Company Law
questions.question: Winding up is governed by:
questions.explanation: Winding up governed by Companies Act provisions, NCLT jurisdiction, and IBC for insolvency.

questions.subject: Professional Ethics
questions.question: Soliciting work by advocate is:
questions.explanation: Rule 36 BCI Rules prohibits soliciting work - it's professional misconduct.

questions.subject: CPC
questions.question: Execution of decree must be within:
questions.explanation: Article 136 Limitation Act - execution application within 12 years.

questions.subject: Evidence Act
questions.question: Hearsay evidence is generally:
questions.explanation: Hearsay generally inadmissible but has exceptions (Sections 32-33).

questions.subject: Labour Law
questions.question: LIFO principle means:
questions.explanation: LIFO - Last In First Out principle for retrenchment.

questions.subject: Arbitration
questions.question: Arbitration agreement must be:
questions.explanation: Section 7 - arbitration agreement must be in writing.
